intro: Paederia chinensis var. megaphylla, commonly known as the giant-leaf paederia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the summer months. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
